variable.name: cpu-cycle-time
variable.description: CPU cycle time in picoseconds

variable.name: voltage
variable.description: CPU voltage in mV

variable.name: max-inst
variable.description: maximum number of instructions to simulate

variable.name: verbose-all
variable.description: globally enable/disable verbosity

variable.name: verbose-setup
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity while setup

variable.name: verbose-step
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when simulating an instruction

variable.name: verbose-dtlb
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when accessing data translation lookahead buffer

variable.name: verbose-itlb
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when accessing instruction translation lookahead buffer

variable.name: verbose-dl1
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when accessing L1 data cache

variable.name: verbose-il1
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when accessing L1 instruction cache

variable.name: verbose-l2
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when accessing L2 unified cache

variable.name: verbose-load
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when simulating a load

variable.name: verbose-store
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when simulating a store

variable.name: verbose-read-memory
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when reading memory for a debug purpose

variable.name: verbose-write-memory
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when writing memory for a debug purpose

variable.name: verbose-exception
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when handling exceptions

variable.name: verbose-set-msr
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when setting MSR

variable.name: verbose-set-hid0
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when setting HID0

variable.name: verbose-set-hid1
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when setting HID1

variable.name: verbose-set-hid2
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when setting HID2

variable.name: verbose-set-l2cr
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity when setting L2CR

variable.name: trap-on-instruction-counter
variable.description: number of simulated instruction before traping

variable.name: bus-cycle-time
variable.description: bus cycle time

variable.name: nice-time
variable.description: maximum time between synchonizations

variable.name: ipc
variable.description: targeted average instructions per second

variable.name: filename
variable.description: the ELF filename to load into memory

variable.name: base-addr
variable.description: if force-base-addr is true force base address for a unique program segment, otherwise ignored

variable.name: force-base-addr
variable.description: if true force base address for a unique program segment

variable.name: force-use-virtual-address
variable.description: force use of virtual addresses instead of physical addresses

variable.name: initialize-extra-segment-bytes
variable.description: whether to initialize extra bytes in segments (p_filesz < p_memsz) to zero (true for standard ELF files)

variable.name: dump-headers
variable.description: dump headers while loading ELF file

variable.name: verbose
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity

variable.name: dwarf-to-html-output-directory
variable.description: DWARF v2/v3 to HTML output directory

variable.name: parse-dwarf
variable.description: Enable/Disable parsing of DWARF debugging informations

variable.name: endianness
variable.description: The endianness of the binary loaded. Available values are: little-endian and big-endian.

variable.name: stack-base
variable.description: The stack base address used for the load and execution of the linux application

variable.name: max-environ
variable.description: The maximum size of the program environment during its execution.

variable.name: argc
variable.description: Number of commands in the program execution line (usually at least one which is the name of the program executed). The different tokens can be set up with the parameters argv[<n>] where <n> can go up to argc - 1.

variable.name: envc
variable.description: Number of environment variables defined for the program execution. The different variables can be set up with the parameters envp[<n>] where <n> can go up to envc - 1.

variable.name: verbose
variable.description: Display verbose information

variable.name: argv[0]
variable.description: The '0' token in the command line.

variable.name: system
variable.description: Emulated system architecture available values are "arm", "arm-eabi" and "powerpc"

variable.name: endianness
variable.description: The endianness of the binary loaded. Available values are: little-endian and big-endian.

variable.name: utsname-sysname
variable.description: The value that the uname system call should return. As this service is providing linux emulation supoort its value should be 'Linux', so you should not modify it.

variable.name: utsname-nodename
variable.description: The network node hostname that the uname system call should return. Default value is localhost, but you could write whatever name you want.

variable.name: utsname-release
variable.description: The kernel realese information that the uname system call should return. This should usually match the linux-kernel parameter.

variable.name: utsname-version
variable.description: The kernel version information that the uname system call should return.

variable.name: utsname-machine
variable.description: The machine information that the uname system call should return. This should be one of the supported architectures (the system parameter, that is, arm or powerpc) or a specific model derived from it (i.e., arm926ejs).

variable.name: utsname-domainname
variable.description: The domain name information that the uname system call should return.

variable.name: org
variable.description: memory origin/base address

variable.name: bytesize
variable.description: memory size in bytes

variable.name: cycle-time
variable.description: memory cycle time

variable.name: read-latency
variable.description: memory read latency

variable.name: write-latency
variable.description: memory write latency

variable.name: verbose
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity

variable.name: authors
variable.description: Authors

variable.name: copyright
variable.description: Copyright

variable.name: description
variable.value: UNISIM ppcemu, user level PowerPC simulator with support of ELF32 binaries and Linux system call translation
variable.description: Description

variable.name: enable-gdb-server
variable.description: Enable/Disable GDB server instantiation

variable.name: enable-inline-debugger
variable.description: Enable/Disable inline debugger instantiation

variable.name: enable-press-enter-at-exit
variable.description: Enable/Disable pressing key enter at exit

variable.name: estimate-power
variable.description: Enable/Disable power estimators instantiation

variable.name: kernel_logger.file
variable.description: Keep logger output in a file

variable.name: kernel_logger.filename
variable.description: Filename to keep logger output (the option file must be activated)

variable.name: kernel_logger.std_err
variable.description: Show logger output through the standard error output

variable.name: kernel_logger.std_err_color
variable.description: Colorize logger output through the standard error output (only works if std_err is active)

variable.name: kernel_logger.std_out
variable.description: Show logger output through the standard output

variable.name: kernel_logger.std_out_color
variable.description: Colorize logger output through the standard output (only works if std_out is active)

variable.name: kernel_logger.xml_file
variable.description: Keep logger output in a file xml formatted

variable.name: kernel_logger.xml_file_gzipped
variable.description: If the xml_file option is active, the output file will be compressed (a .gz extension will be automatically added to the xml_filename option

variable.name: kernel_logger.xml_filename
variable.description: Filename to keep logger xml output (the option xml_file must be activated)

variable.name: license
variable.description: License

variable.name: program-name
variable.description: Program name

variable.name: schematic
variable.description: path to simulator schematic

variable.name: version
variable.description: Version
